concept.title: Creating an Image
concept.shortdesc: When you create an image, you must decide whether you're going to create the image from existing resources, from new resources, or from Amazon EC2.

conbody.draft-comment: What else can we say about images? Maybe a tad more about how they're used in cloud computing?
conbody.p: Creating an image is a process of bundling, uploading, and registering a resource or set of resources. For a Linux image, the set of resources is a root image, a kernel, and a ramdisk. For a Windows image, the resource is a root image.
This section describes how to create an image based on your needs and requirements. Choose from the following table to select the tasks for creating your image:

A root file system from an Amazon EC2 image
